titleStmt.title: Quæstiones in sacra theologia [jure civili, medicina, philosophia] discutiendæ Oxonii in vesperiis septimo [nono] die mensis Julii anno Domini 1683
titleStmt.author: University of Oxford.

publicationStmt.publisher: Ex officina Leonardi Lichfield. Acad. Typog.,

notesStmt.note: This item appears twice on UMI microfilm reel 2292, first at position 20 incorrectly identified on film and in reel guide as Wing O957, and at postion 21 correctly identified as Wing O958

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

revisionDesc.change: 2007-11 AptaraKeyed and coded from ProQuest page images
2010-09 John LattaText and markup reviewed and edited

div.head: QUAESTIONES IN SACRA THEOLOGIA DISCUTIENDAE OXONII IN VESPERIIS.

opener.date: Septimo Die Menſis Julii Anno Domini 1683.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris ABRAH. CAMPION, è Coll. Trin.

list.head: An
list.item: Superioritas Epiſcoporum ſupra Presbyteros ſit Apoſtolicae Inſtitutionis. Aff.
Sectarii Communionem Eccleſiae Anglicanae recufantes ſint Schiſmatici. Aff.
Sit jus Populi ſuos eligere Paſtores. Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris THOMAE TURNNER è C. C. C.

list.head: An
list.item: Omnes Eccleſiae particulares ſint quoad Juriſdictionem aequales. Aff.
Cultus à Pontificiis, Imaginibus praeſtitus ſit Idololatricus. Aff.
Articuli Fidei ſint ad normam humanae Rationis exigendi. Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris GVIL. TURNER, è Coll. Trinit.

list.head: An
list.item: Detur peccatum ex natura ſua veniale. Neg.
Civilis Juriſdictio jure concedatur perſonis Eccleſiaſticis. Aff.
Eccleſia habeat poteſtatem conſtituendi novos Articulos Fidei. Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris HEN. MAURICE, è Coll. Jeſu.

list.head: An
list.item: Eccleſia Chriſtiana integra maneat ablato Papâ. Aff.
Eccleſiae Britannicae ad Patriarchatum Romanum olim pertinebant. Neg.
Ordinatio ad conſtituendos Epiſcopos, & Presbyteros ſit neceſſaria. Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris NICOLAI HALL, è Coll. Wadham.

list.head: An
list.item: Poſt conſignatum ſacrae Scripturae Canonem, novae Revelationes ſint expectandae. Neg.
Lectio Scripturarum ſit populo permittenda. Aff.
Conſcientia errans excuſat peccatum. Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris ROBERTI HUNTINGTON, è Coll. Mert.

list.head: An
list.item: Regimen Eccleſiaſticum jus habeat in Civile. Neg.
Imperium & Dogmata Eccleſiae Romanae, Politica magis ſint quàm Chriſtiana. Aff.
Principis juſſu res adiaphorae fiant neceſſariae. Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris THO. SMITH, è Coll. Magd.

list.head: An
list.item: Sextus Canon Concilii Nicaeni adſtruat authoritatem, quam ſibi arrogat Pontifex Romanus in Univerſam Eccleſiam. Neg.
Epiſcopi totam ſuam poteſtatem Epiſcopalem immediatè habeant à Chriſto. Aff.
Eccleſia habeat jus ſtatuendi Caeremonias in Sacro Cultu. Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris BAPT. LEVINZ, è Coll. Magd.

list.head: An
list.item: Preces pro defunctis antiquitùs uſurpatae adſtruant Romanenſium Purgatorium. Neg.
Detur peccatum Originale. Aff.
Poligamia ſit licita. Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris JOHAN. BEALE è C. C. C.

list.head: An
list.item:
Communio ſub utra
que ſpecie ſit in Eccleſia retinenda. Aff.
Sancti ſint invocandi. Neg.
Intentio Sacerdotis ſit neceſſaria ad beneficium aliquod in Sacramentis percipiendum. Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris THOMAE BEVAN è Coll. Jeſu.

list.head: An
list.item: In legitimâ Sacramentorum adminiſtratione aliquid hominibus conferatur a Deo. Aff.
Liceat Chriſtiano ex intuitu Mercedis operari. Aff.

Gratuita Remiſſio, et Chriſti ſatisfactio ſint 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris JACOBI JEFFREYS è Coll. Jeſu.

list.head: An
list.item: Leges humanae obligent Conſcientiam. Aff.
Liceat ſubditis contra legitimum ſuum Magiſtratum ſub praetextu quovis Religionis arma movere. Neg.
Juramentum fidelitatis Magiſtratibus a Clericis aequè ac a Laicis ſit praeſtandum. Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones in JURE CIVILI DISCUTIENDAE OXONII IN VESPERIIS.
Quaeſtiones Inceptoris RICHARDI MARIS è Coll. D. Jo. Bapt.

list.head: An
list.item:
Princeps ſit 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
Aff.
Ex delicto defuncti haeres teneatur. Neg.
Index ſecundum probationes in Judicio pronunciare debeat. Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones in MEDICINA diſcutiendae Oxonii in Veſperiis.
Quaeſtiones Inceptoris PHINEAE ELWOOD è C. C. C.

list.head: An
list.item: Icterus ſolummodo procedat ab obſtructione Hepatis, et ductus bilarii Neg.
Salvia conducat ad Concoctionem. Aff.
Secretio Glandularum fiat per fermentum. Neg.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris GUIL. GIBBONS è Coll. D. Jo. Bapt.

list.head: An
list.item: Urina ſecernatur a ſanguine in Renibus. Aff.
In Febribus putridis curandis Criſis ſit expectanda. Neg.
Sanguis cum ſucco nerveo ſit immediata materia nutritionis. Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones Inceptoris DAVIDIS WILLIAMS è Coll. Oriel.

list.head: An
list.item: Hepar ſanguificet. Neg.
Concoctio fiat a Calore. Neg.
Calor ſit de Eſſentia Febris. Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones in Philoſophia diſcutiendae Oxonii in Veſperiis.

list.head: An
list.item: Mores animi ſequantur temperamentum Corporis. Aff.
Paſſiones ſint Vitia. Neg.
Leges obligent ſummam poteſtatem. Neg.

div.p: Reſp. GUL. DRAKE. A. M. è C.C.C.

div.head: Quaeſtiones in S. THEOLOGIA Diſcutiendae Oxonii in COMITIIS

opener.date: Nono die Menſis Julii Anno Dom. 1683.

list.head: An
list.item: Laudandi ſint Principes qui legibus contra, Haereticos et Schiſmaticos latis Eccleſiae unitati & paci proſpiciunt. Aff.
Principes Chriſtiani Viros idoneos ad Eccleſiaſtica beneficia nominare Lege divinâ prohibeantur. Neg.
Ordinationes a Schiſmaticis noſtris factae pro irritis haberi debeant. Aff.

div.p: Reſpond. Inceptore HEN. MAURICE è Coll. Jeſu.

div.head: Quaeſtiones in JURE CIVILI diſcutiendae Oxonii in Comitiis.

list.head: An
list.item: Cujuſlibet Poteſtatis arbitrium ſit regulatum. Aff.
Coecus Judicis Officio fungi poſſit. Aff.
Infames in Cauſis criminalibus teſtes eſſe poſſint. Neg.

div.p: Reſpondente Inceptore JOHAN. CONANT. è Coll. Mert.

div.head: Quaeſtiones in Medicina diſcutiendae in Comitiis.

list.head: An
list.item: Primarium Hepatis munus ſit bilem ſecernere, Aff.
Dentur Medicamenta electivè purgantia. Neg.
Cibi in Ventriculo diſſolvantur perfermentationem. Aff.

div.p: Reſp. SAM. DESMAISTRES è Coll. Oriel Med. Bac.

div.head: Quaeſtiones in Philoſophiâ diſcutiendae in Comitiis.

list.head: An
list.item: Democratia ſit tyrannis. Aff.
Homines plus debeant Arti quàm naturae. Neg.
Utilitas ſit fundamentum Juris naturalis. Neg.

div.p: Reſpond. THO. NEWEY. A. M. ex AEde. Chriſti.
OXONII, Ex Officina LEONARDI LICHFIELD. Acad. Typog. Anno Domini 1683.
